column4: Is anyone willing to help? I am greeted by a spastically flashing cursor upon boot. This is after 1) installing Windows XP on a separate partition, and 2) restoring GRUB
How did you re-install grub?
according to the guide on the wiki. I verified that I had mounted only my ubuntu partition, then I typed this:
sudo grub-install --root-directory=/media/0d104aff-ec8c-44c8-b811-92b993823444 /dev/sda
Do you have more than one hard drive?
I have only one internal hard drive, a Samsung Spinpoint 1TB SATA drive.
!bootinfo | gdea73
ok
I get this error running the script: ./boot_info_script.sh: 353: Syntax error: "(" unexpected (expecting "fi")
It's not an sh script. It's a bash script.
Oh. I thought sh = bash ...
http://pastebin.com/eFht4qHe
!ot | ippos
Do you see the grub menu if you hold shift during boot?
Okay, I will try that. I'm running the livecd now so I will be offline for a while. hope to come back soon. thanks.
I'm back... no luck.
It just says GRUB Loading... and then clears screen and shows the blinking __
Interesting. Has it ever worked since you ran grub-install?
Nope. Sure it's interesting, but this is also kind of an important workstation :S
!language | microc0sm
!patience | microc0sm
If you need something working now, then you can try booting Ubuntu with Super GRUB2 Disk.
Okay. I don't have much *time* now, actually, but I'll look into that.
